stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the stream building a new Wild-West minecart section for Return to Yoshi’s Island, tweaking camera flags, cart physics, and new sound effects while chatting about personal topics like PayPal issues, Twitter plans, and bad doctors.

development_findings.summary: He has spent the past week or two importing Biobak’s assets and laying out a cowboy-themed level featuring a minecart chase inside a cave.
Red-coin stars now leave the player inside the level; 100-coin stars are removed and a global coin counter is planned.
development_findings.quote: I also made it so that red coin stars don't put you out of the stage anymore ... I don't think 100 coin stars should be in this game.

development_findings.summary: Early attempt with three parallel player-sized carts proved too hard; pivoted to one large cart for Mario plus three small Snifit carts.
development_findings.quote: This idea for the minecarts is just not good … What if instead of three small ones, there's just one big one that you can walk around on?

development_findings.summary: Created a cutscene where three Snifits jump into carts, then tuned cart speed (BParam values) and camera position to keep gameplay and visibility smooth.
Fixed a long-standing camera bug: keep-out flags were being treated as indices; value 3 let the camera pass through walls.
development_findings.quote: I feel like there is a bug with the camera code ... when we have both on, they actually turn into three and three means it can always go through.

development_findings.summary: Inserted new SFX: ground-pound jump (MK64), spin-jump (Melee), longer falling yell; still iterating on pitch/length.
Tried vertex-color lighting instead of textures but abandoned because 'couldn't make it look good'.
Emphasized proper analog stick scaling (slow vs fast tilt) and mocked modern games that omit it.
development_findings.quote: They invented this in 1996 and there are still games out in 2023 that don't use this.

development_findings.summary: Joked about an accessibility ‘little brother mode’ that would let AI clear a star after two failures.
Needs Zeina’s new milk-bottle object for the level; placeholder for now.
development_findings.quote: Zeina, you make milk bottles. I need them.

context_findings.summary: PayPal has frozen his balance; he can spend on Steam/eBay but can't withdraw, considering buying CS:GO skins.
context_findings.quote: PayPal refused to let me use my PayPal money ... I can't send it to myself.

context_findings.summary: Exploring Twitter monetization; has ~1 M impressions in 3 months, needs 5 M; may hire social-media manager on revenue share.
context_findings.quote: I'm thinking we need to go all out on Twitter ... I should hire a social media manager.

context_findings.summary: Prefers paying a cleaner to keeping house tidy; views personal cleaning as wasted time.
context_findings.quote: I simply do not care about having a clean house ... It is a lot cheaper to just do that.

context_findings.summary: Deep distrust of doctors after poor elbow/wrist treatment; now favors self-directed physiotherapy.
context_findings.quote: I kind of just gave up on doctors ... Every time I went to a doctor recently, it's just been worse for me.

context_findings.summary: Mentioned buying a house (not fully paid yet); no landlord; furnace noise in house disrupts stream.
context_findings.quote: I have a fucking house. It's not technically mine yet.

context_findings.summary: Philosophy on creativity: finds rickrolls unoriginal; believes human value lies in new creative expression.
context_findings.quote: I just don't think rickrolls are very creative ... Isn't the point of the human experience to have creative expression?

context_findings.summary: Shows frustration/excitement cycle: thrilled by moon lighting and minecart success, annoyed by furnace and Zeina’s loud activities.

biobak.summary: Provided the new level assets (“Biomex things”) that Kaze spent weeks importing.
biobak.quote: I spent the last two weeks working on this level here importing Biobak's things.

zeina.summary: Tasked with modelling milk-bottle objects for the minecart scene.
zeina.quote: Zeina, you make milk bottles. I need them.

zeina.summary: Generated loud furnace/oven noise upstairs, repeatedly interrupting Kaze; playful on-stream banter.
zeina.quote: Oh my god, Zeina, shut up. This is so annoying. Why is she doing this to me?

key_stories.title: Minecart Chase Design Pivot
key_stories.summary: The original plan placed Mario in one of three narrow carts alongside Snifits, but testing showed cart-hopping was too punishing. Kaze rethought the mechanic mid-stream.
key_stories.challenge: Players kept falling while switching carts, and the camera clipped on corners.
key_stories.process: Tweaked speed and alignment, added a cutscene, then decided to replace the trio with one large player cart.
key_stories.outcome: New direction increases maneuvering space; shooting and visuals still outstanding.
key_stories.key_quote: This idea for the minecarts is just not good ... What if instead of three small ones, there's just one big one that you can walk around on?

key_stories.title: Red-Coin Star Flow Fix
key_stories.summary: Kaze removed the forced exit after collecting red-coin stars to keep gameplay uninterrupted.
key_stories.challenge: Traditional SM64 ejection breaks pacing, especially in exploratory levels.
key_stories.process: Altered engine so red-coin stars flag doesn’t trigger level reload; discussed removing 100-coin stars.
key_stories.outcome: Players stay in level upon collection; broader rethink of coin economy.
key_stories.key_quote: I also made it so that red coin stars don't put you out of the stage anymore.

key_stories.title: Camera Flag Bug Discovery
key_stories.summary: While staging the minecart cutscene, Kaze uncovered an index vs. bit-flag mix-up causing the camera to ignore wall collision.
key_stories.challenge: Cutscene camera slipped through cave walls, ruining presentation.
key_stories.process: Traced issue to keep-in/keep-out flag being treated as an index; value 3 allowed free movement.
key_stories.outcome: Fixed flag usage; camera now respects geometry.
key_stories.key_quote: They actually turn into 3, and 3 means it can always go through.

key_stories.title: Distrust of Medical Advice
key_stories.summary: Kaze recounted injuries mishandled by doctors, leading to lasting wrist pain.
key_stories.challenge: Doctor prescribed painkillers and cortisol injections rather than therapy.
key_stories.process: Followed advice briefly, condition worsened; switched to self-led physiotherapy.
key_stories.outcome: Elbow healed, wrist partially damaged; fostered skepticism of healthcare.
key_stories.key_quote: I kind of just gave up on doctors ... It's much better to actually do proper physiotherapy.

open_questions.context: Kaze pivoted to a large player cart but did not finish shooting mechanics or visual pass.
questions: Will the final version use one large cart or revert to multiple?
How will Snifit projectile timing be balanced?
What visual/audio cues will guide players?

open_questions.context: He mentioned removing 100-coin stars and tracking coins globally.
questions: How will the global counter integrate with progression or rewards?
Will coins still heal Mario or serve other functions?

open_questions.context: Zeina was asked to model milk bottles for the cowboy level but no further detail given.
questions: What gameplay purpose will milk bottles serve?
Has Zeina begun modelling/animating them and what style is intended?

open_questions.context: Kaze’s PayPal balance is restricted, affecting purchases and payouts.
questions: Is this impacting project budgeting or contractor payments?
Has the team considered alternative payment platforms?

open_questions.context: Kaze considers a social-media manager to hit 5 M impressions.
questions: What type of content and frequency does he envision?
Will behind-the-scenes dev footage be shared publicly or held for documentary/promotional beats?
